content: this vest is designed to be super easy and fun to knit making it a great project for beginner garment knitters with its relaxed and comfortable fit you will find yourself reaching for this vest often and its simplicity makes it a fantastic wardrobe staple the pattern includes detailed instructions with some handy extra tips for newbies starting at the back shoulders it is knit top-down on circular needles which is a great method to check the fit as you go and is very easy to add or subtract length there are also some handy hints for picking up stitches for the neck and armbands which you can apply any time you need to pick stitches up in future **sizes xs s m ** l xl 2xl **3xl 4xl 5xl ** **to fit bust ** **71-76 81-86 91-96 ** 101-106 111-117 122-127 **132-137 142-147 152-158 **cm **28-30 32-34 36-38 ** 40-42 44-46 48-50 **52-54 56-58 60-62 ** inches **finished bust ** **76 86 96 ** 106 116 126 **136 146 156 ** cm **30 34 38 ** 41 5 45 5 49 5 **53 5 57 5 61 5 ** inches designed to fit with between 0-3cm / 0-1 5 of positive ease depending on preferred fit **yarn ** 8ply to light 10ply / dk to worsted weight yarn we used woolly 8ply 100m/50g for our main sample another gorgeous option is to use a 4ply / fingering weight yarn held with 1 strand of lace mohair **quantity ** approximately **352 414 488 ** 539 613 690 **745 850 910 ** metres the fit of our sample is fairly cropped but you can easily adjust the length if adding length to body you will need approximately **20 22 25 ** 27 30 32 **35 37 40 ** extra metres of yarn for every 2 5cm of length added **needles ** **body ** 4 50mm 60-100cm circular needles depending on pattern size **edging ** 3 50mm 40cm optional 60cm and 80-100cm circular needles if you don t mind the magic loop technique you can just use the longer needles adjust needle size as necessary to match pattern gauge **gauge ** 18 sts x 25 row to 10cm in stocking stitch on larger needles **extras ** 1-2 stitch markers a stitch holder spare circular needles or scrap yarn for holding stitches **sample 1 ** is a size s and was knit in woolly 8ply we added stripes by knitting 10 row of each colour we used the following approximate quantities of each colour - 1 5 balls in peachy keen - 1 5 balls in quackers - 2 5 balls in punkin **sample 2 ** is a size m and was knit in heirloom merino fleck 8ply in col 6552 linen
